abstract: General Motors is talking to BAIC, China’s fifth largest car maker, about a partial sale of assets associated with its Saab brand, including tooling and technology, sources told Reuters.
snippet: General Motors is talking to BAIC, China’s fifth largest car maker, about a partial sale of assets associated with its Saab brand, including tooling and technology, sources told Reuters.
lead_paragraph: General Motors is talking to BAIC, China’s fifth largest car maker, about a partial sale of assets associated with its Saab brand, including tooling and technology, two people with direct knowledge of the discussions told Reuters.

headline.main: G.M. May Be in Talks on Partial Saab Sale to BAIC
